greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (1<=k<=n) = Sum_{i=1..n, j=1..k, gcd(i,j)=1} (n+1-i)*(k+1-j)
comment: T(n,k) = (1/4) * number of ways to select 3 distinct points forming a triangle of unsigned area = 1/2 from a rectangle of grid points with side lengths n and k.
Permutations of the 3 points are not counted separately.
example: a(1) = 1 because 4 triangles of area 1/2 in a [0 1]X[0 1] square can be formed by cutting the unit square into 2 triangles along the diagonals.
maple: for i from 1 to m do for j from 1 to n do
if gcd(i,j)=1 then a:=a+(m+1-i)*(n+1-j); fi; od: od: a; end;
for m from 1 to 12 do lprint([seq(T(m,n),n=1..m)]); od: # _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 04 2020
xref: This triangle is equivalent to the table in A114999.
results.author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Oct 15 2018
ext: Replaced definition (now a comment) by explicit formula. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 04 2020
